The chunk discusses boolean flags related to rendering optimization and threading in Panda, including whether geometry should be paged asynchronously or synchronously, allowing flattening of live scene graph nodes, and enabling non-pipelining threads for debugging purposes. These settings are part of a broader document detailing configuration variables for system interactions, window properties, and performance optimizations in the Panda framework.

future. When this is false, geometry is always paged in immediately when
needed, holding up the frame render if necessary. allow-live-flatten bool 1 Set this true to allow the use of flatten_strong() or any variant on
a node that is attached to a live scene graph node, or false to disallow
this. Flattening a live scene graph node can cause problems when
threading is enabled. This variable only has an effect when Panda is not
compiled for a release build. allow-nonpipeline-threads bool 0 This variable should only be set true for debugging or development
purposes. When true, the threading-model variable may specify a threaded
pipeline mode, even if pipelining is not compiled in. This will
certainly result in erroneous behavior, and quite likely will cause a
